Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I needed”
Reviews.Author: Tricia S
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely fit the bill with what I needed. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms were all recently renovated with a very nice, modern look, and the place honestly felt like a home away from home. If any issues arose, management got on them right away to make sure they were taken care of immediately. The kitchen is another good feature, helping the room feel like home while also controlling dining costs during your stay. The location is ideal too as it's situated right between the 805 and 15 freeways, with the 56 just slightly to the north - this made it really easy to get anywhere in the San Diego area. This Homestead is a great, low-key place to stay and I definitely recommend it to anyone needing to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: facua-nj
Reviews.Content: Staff helpful nice and easy to work with.Christine at the frount desk made it comfortable and easy too ask questions.Rooms are clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hospitality and smiles”
Reviews.Author: Regis P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homestead in Tigard Oregon for 18 months for buisness and moved down to San Diego on buisness . I have been here now for almost 2 months and the Management and staff has made this a wonderfull experience in making myself and my team memeber feel like part of the family Emeil and Cheyne are always on the property talking to the guest and getting our opinions and concerns which we dont have any very well run property , The front desk staff is alwyas cherrfull and the housekeeping staff Violetta makes my weekly cleaning remarkable like I just moved in. Attention to detail will keep me coming back and this is one of the best properties I have ever stayed at. Great Job all !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lavoris
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Homestead a few occasions and I've always had a wonderful stay. Front desk clerks and management are always welcoming and polite. Also since my last stay the rooms have been renovated and look very nice and up to date, very home away from home feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was best ever”
Reviews.Author: Mlee6012
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay at Homestead Suites Sorrento Valley. I cannot say enough about April, Lynn, Christine and Shane in the front desk. Theyare the best ever being so nice, so helpful and so knowledgeable - they care so much for their guests. And Violetta in housekeeping and Eddie in maintenance are also wonderful and the hotel is lucky to have them. As you can see this group made my stay really enjoyable - I miss them all, Gary Leeds

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mahesh M
Reviews.Content: It was a good experience staying in this suite which also has a kitchen. Service at the front desk was awesome. Christine helped a lot in smooth check in and check out (which i had done more than couple of times in my 3 weeks of stay).

Reviews.Title: “Don't ignore these reviews they are the real thing”
Reviews.Author: maze916
Reviews.Content: Before staying there I read reviews of poor housekeeping and bedbugs which for some crazy reason I ignored. I even ignored the mattress in the dumpster when I checked in. If that didn't say bed bugs what else would have. Anyway internet didn't work half the time which is an extra charge. the housekeeping was poor. and yes bedbugs forced me to leave. The management was not surprised and they gave me a whooping $20.00 in quarters so I could wash my cloths. The dry clean cloths I just threw out. They offered no apology. What else could be said .

Reviews.Title: “Not what we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Jim and Deb M
Reviews.Content: Small and dated room. bathtub didn't drain properly. Pull knob for shower was hard to work , towel rack rusted. Didnt have any coat hangers or cooking utensils, although we did get some when we went to the desk. Advertised full kitchen but didn't have oven. Did have a 2 burner stove, refrigerator and microwave. Room seemed clean. Overall we were disappointed and we wouldn't go back. Not very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the review here”
Reviews.Author: Machilus
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 3 times in this month. Before check in at the last time, I checked tripadvisor and was shocked by the bad review. Honestly speaking, the hotel is pretty fine to stay for a couple of days. The rooms are with kitchen which is possible for cooking and they even prepared all the kitchen supplies, such as spot, spoon, folk. I noticed that many complaints were about the cleanliness. They might have problems on that years ago. But for my recent stay, it was quite good. They charged internet for 4.99 per/stay which is a little bit expensive for one night but ok per two or more. The interenet is not so good.

Reviews.Title: “this place is a JOKE!!”
Reviews.Author: chainsawbunnie13
Reviews.Content: First of all, they try charging your absolutely outrageous prices for such a RUNDOWN place! Second of all, the housekeeping here is HORRIBLE! They clean your floors with the same old town they've been cleaning every other nasty room with and they half do their job! Thirdly, the management here are a bunch of trashy, unpleasant, unsightly jerks. The only nice thing about this place is the location to the highways and the front desk clerks are amazing and helpful. My room was a MESS. They want to charge you like you are staying in a 5 star hotel, when its clearly not even a 2 star. There was TRASH under my beds, the kitchen countertops weren't even wiped down and the fridge had mold in it as well as the bathtub! The toilet looked as though it hadn't been cleaned out in a few months and the sheets were SPOTTED with dirt\blood?! I'm not sure which. I am far from over exaggerating this place! It was absolutely DREADFUL! I wouldn't recommend it to an enemy! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!

Reviews.Title: “Broken, Unclean, Small, and Run Down”
Reviews.Author: damon_jackson
Reviews.Content: During our relocation to San Diego, my wife and I were scheduled to stay in this hotel for a month while we searched for permanent housing. The hotel was so run down and awful that we immediately shortened our stay to one night. Although the room is a suite, it was tiny. Smaller than some regular hotel rooms I have stayed in. We asked the front desk three times if all the rooms had the same floor plan, and were assured they do and are all just as small. We would not have even been able to unpack our cars and fit our belongings inside. The upholstery on the chair was ripped. The reading lamp at the bed was broken. The cupboard door fell apart in my hand when I opened it. The coffee pot was cracked. The vent on the AC was broken. Although they knew there would be two of us, there was only one spoon and one cup. The cup was very dirty. It was an awful experience, and I don't think my new company will be using this hotel again for future new hires. It is a terrible introduction to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: aadi4u
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel conviniently located to highways and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lexiscoupe
Reviews.Content: I saw a few reviews that mentioned this hotel was not as bad a published reviews..I can assure you IT IS WORSE!!!!! Trash under the beds and behind the dresser. Kitchen and eating area MAY have been wiped down. Not sure the last time the cleaning staff actually mopped when the moped the floor or clean/disinfected the toilet. The bedspreads were worn & old..the hotel rooms have not had any upgrades. THE MOST DISGUSTING PART WAS THE ROOM WAS INFESTED WITH ROACHES!!! Not just a random one or two...but roaches that came out during the day to let you know you are visiting their home. NASTY, we checked out as soon as we possible could, about 10 hours after we checked in (we got there late at night so didn't realize how bad the place was until the morning)

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as they say, but still would be my last choice.”
Reviews.Author: martyman13
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with my wife while visiting Qualcomm. If I'm not mistaken, all rooms are motel-style with doors facing the outside (most facing the parking area). Quality wasn't as bad as others described, but there were a few issues. Room cleaning costs extra, but our room was fairly clean when we checked in. Towels felt like they were starched, some kitchen utensils were dirty (wash them first if going to use them). No restaurant on-site, but the worst was when we used up our first coffee pack, went down to receptionist to get more and found that there weren't going to be any (coffee was ordered but hasn't arrived yet)! Ended up going to Starbux the rest of our stay. On the positive side, they didn't charge me colleage or me for Wi-Fi. There are a bunch of restaurants about a mile down the road before the highway and around that area, otherwise go to Eastwood Mall for upscale dining.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty!!”
Reviews.Author: DaveofTucson
Reviews.Content: Besides the wonderful front desk clerk. This place is pretty bad! Both rooms were dirty, The cheap towels needed replaced and the Plastic Crackly Super firm Mattress is the worst that I have ever slept on, not to mention the mushy pillows. - My toilet ran continuously through the night and you could hear the water running from the other rooms through the walls. They also wanted to charge for the use of high speed internet. Warning - Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Trailer Park”
Reviews.Author: natjmk12
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty. Dried urine on the toilet seat. Cups and bowls had caked on old food. The plastic glasses has dirt and little hairs in them. Countertop looked like it had not been wiped down. Some towels were stained and dirty! Like living in someone's trailer. No exercise room. Sign inside room says they only change the sheets once a week. "Spruce up" room cleaning service available for $5 (but they won't change the sheets) and "Full cleaning" service for $10. By the looks of my room, the initial cleaning doesn't appear to be included in the rate. Wireless internet is $5 a day and it's SLOW. At least the parking is free. Surprised I didn't find dirty sheets on the bed. Can't forget to mention the discolored wall next to the toilet from urine splatterings. Will never stay in any of the "Extended Stay Hotels" again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations - not as bad as previous reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFieldGuy
Reviews.Content: You would think from some previous reviews that this place was terrible. But for me, it was just fine. Tidy and clean, if a bit dumpy. Bathroom worked, appliances worked as near as I can tell. Basically an uneventful and perfectly satisfactory night for a business trip. This probably wouldn't be my choice were I bringing the wife or family, but it was adequate for a business trip. And the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Boy”
Reviews.Author: Radio_Dude
Reviews.Content: This place had more problems than it was worth. The TV didn't work, the water leaked in the bathroom, dog hair all over the room and that was the good parts. Next was a water main break which wouldn't allow you to take a shower. It fixed the water leak in the bathroom though. Don't stay here, stay across the street at the Holiday Inn Express, much better.

Reviews.Title: “one out of five is too high! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: terpdon
Reviews.Content: My company put me up in this hotel while I was moving here for a job. The room was dirty, there was a food stain on the back of the door like there was a food fight in there before I checked in. There was a black ring around the bathtub, and the mattress had a broken spring which stabbed me in the back. The high speed internet was a joke, if I so much as watched a youtube video, it would lock me out, telling me I had exceeded my bandwidth. Plus, the signal was so weak, it would have been faster to use a dialup modem. The kicker is that after I checked out, I received three bogus charges on my credit card that I had provided for incidentals, to the tune of more than $500. They said my company didn't pay the room tax, so they just threw it on my credit card WITHOUT TELLING ME. It's now December, and only half of that money has been refunded. The balance is sitting on my credit card gaining interest! For your own sake, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “budget budget budget”
Reviews.Author: nosnerk
Reviews.Content: The rate is the only decent feature. Booked this hotel because of a last minute need. The 2 room suite was large enough but quite dirty and run down. The trash was left from previous guest, cobwebs, tub/shower was gross. If you need a place to sleep with adequat space OK, else ... The front desk people were very nice though (maybe they felt sorry).

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean and Confortable”
Reviews.Author: micondo
Reviews.Content: Accessible site and confortable rooms - Spacious Suites- Free Wireless Interenet Access-

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Area - Dirty Room!”
Reviews.Author: madera99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a nice location in San Diego. The hotel looks nice, but once you get inside, you quickly realize why it's cheap. (we paid $60 on hotwire) The rooms are very small and DIRTY! The bed is small, the kitchen is so small- it's not functional. The bathroom was dirty. You can tell it is poorly cleaned after every visit. Because this hotel is "apartment style" with kitchens - they do not clean the room every day if you are are staying for more than one night. The bathroom was so dirty, you can tell they don't even clean it well after each guest checks out. This hotel is fine for a quick one night stay if you get a great deal. Otherwise, I would stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Tired little hotel - between a Holiday Inn Express & Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Kind of a tired little hotel...really, almost a motel. Popcorn ceilings, worn furnishings, and the shower had no tub (i.e., just a curtain and the tile floor was contiguous with the rest of the room). The airco, bathroom fan, etc. rattle and whine because they're old. The "ergonomic workstation" was pretty funny...a table with a stool in the corner. Staff was friendly (quickly fixed my broken television)...about 25 channels on cable plus free Showtime. The place just feels old to me. I don't get that "clean" feeling you get from some places. Very thin blanket, lumpy pillows. Kitchen area was nice (toaster, microwave, etc.), but the dishes in mine were not really clean. Also, you're very close to the Marine airbase - expect very loud booming jets overhead from about 7am to 11pm. You'll need to cover your ears when you're outside! Some days they go by almost every 15 minutes all day/night. The hotel is in the middle of a huge industrial area, so everything around is office buildings, etc. Be aware there's no housekeeping if you stay for less than 7 days unless you pay $5/day. There is no pool or fitness room, though for $5/day you can go to the local Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quality”
Reviews.Author: vacation joie
Reviews.Content: My husband found this great deal of $47 per night on Hotwire.com. We stayed here just one night on our way to San Diego but enjoyed it thoroughly. We drove in late from SF and were met by the manager at 1am with a smile. Check-in was quick and easy and she gave us a room right next to the office. We were able to get settled in and fast asleep in just a few minutes. Even when we called the manager in her hotel room at 1:30am for shampoo, she was very nice. (note, shampoo not in rooms, but provided free if ask at the desk). The location of the hotel is surrounded by corporate office buildings and many other extended stay hotels, so needless to say it was VERY quiet in the area. There were few guests checked in as well, making parking ample and the area extra quiet. The room itself was very nice. A little small but just enough room for 1-2 ppl looking to spend a day or two. The kitchenette was more than enough for our leftovers and breakfast food- there was an almost full sized refrigerator, stove, microwave, toaster, coffee maker and lots of pots and pans. Bed was well-made, furniture looked new and well kept. The bathroom was suprisingly large. Clean and with enough towels and soap. Overall, very clean, excellent for the price and great staff. We were very happy with our stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Homestead Studio Suites San Diego - Sorrento Mesa
HotelInfo.Address: 9880 Pacific Heights Boulevard, San Diego, CA 92118
